title: [CRITICAL] Implement Final Color Palette
body:
## üé® Description

Current implementation uses Orange/Blue/Purple palette (#FF6B35, #004E89, #1A1A2E) but requirements specify "Retro Black background, Neon Yellow highlights, Arcade Blue/Cheese Orange/Fresh Green buttons". This discrepancy creates brand inconsistency and potential user confusion.

## üéØ Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Design team confirms final color palette with stakeholders
- [ ] Update `UI_Brief.md` with approved colors and hex codes
- [ ] Implement colors in Unity UI prefabs and components
- [ ] Update any CSS/styling for web components
- [ ] Validate contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards (4.5:1 minimum)
- [ ] Test color implementation across all three screens (Start, Resolving, Result)
- [ ] Verify colors render correctly on different devices and screen types

## üîß Technical Details

**Files to Update:**
- `unity-client/UI_Brief.md` - Color palette documentation
- `unity-client/Assets/Scripts/GameConfig.cs` - Color constants (if needed)
- Unity UI prefabs for all screens
- Any shader or material files using hardcoded colors

**Current Colors:**
```css
Primary: #FF6B35 (Vibrant Orange)
Secondary: #004E89 (Deep Blue)
Background: #1A1A2E (Dark Purple)
Surface: #16213E (Navy)
```

**Required Clarification:**
- Exact hex codes for "Retro Black", "Neon Yellow", "Arcade Blue", "Cheese Orange", "Fresh Green"
- Which elements should use which colors
- Accessibility requirements for contrast ratios

## üìã Definition of Done

- All screens use consistent, approved color palette
- Design team sign-off on visual implementation
- QA validation across all supported devices and browsers
- Documentation updated to reflect implemented colors
- No accessibility violations for color contrast

## üö® Impact

**Risk Level**: High - Launch Blocker
**User Impact**: Brand confusion, inconsistent experience
**Technical Debt**: Medium - requires coordination across design and development

title: [CRITICAL] Validate WAX Wallet Integration on Testnet
body:
## üîó Description

WAX Cloud Wallet integration workflow needs complete validation in WAX testnet environment to ensure core functionality works before launch. Current implementation exists but hasn't been fully tested end-to-end with actual blockchain transactions.

## üéØ Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Deploy DBP token and gameplay contracts to WAX testnet
- [ ] Configure Unity client with testnet endpoints
- [ ] Test wallet connection on multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- [ ] Validate transaction signing and blockchain confirmation flow
- [ ] Test error scenarios (connection failures, transaction timeouts, insufficient WAX)
- [ ] Verify mobile browser compatibility (iOS Safari, Chrome Android)
- [ ] Test wallet account switching and logout functionality
- [ ] Validate DBP balance updates after successful plays
- [ ] Confirm 35% win rate through statistical sampling (50+ plays)
- [ ] Document any browser or device-specific issues

## üîß Technical Requirements

**Testnet Setup:**
- WAX Testnet accounts: `dbptoken.acc`, `gameplay.acc`
- Sufficient WAX tokens for deployment and testing
- RNG Oracle integration with `orng.wax`

**Files to Update:**
- `unity-client/Assets/Scripts/GameConfig.cs` - Testnet configuration
- `unity-client/Assets/Scripts/WalletConnection.cs` - Error handling
- `unity-client/Assets/Scripts/GameplayManager.cs` - Transaction flow

**Testing Matrix:**
| Browser | Desktop | Mobile | Status |
|---------|---------|--------|---------|
| Chrome | Required | Required | ‚è≥ |
| Firefox | Required | Optional | ‚è≥ |
| Safari | Required | Required | ‚è≥ |
| Edge | Optional | N/A | ‚è≥ |

## üìã Definition of Done

- End-to-end wallet flow tested and working on primary browsers
- All error scenarios handled gracefully with user-friendly messages
- Mobile browser compatibility validated on real devices
- Statistical validation of 35% win rate (¬±5% tolerance)
- Documentation updated with test results and known limitations
- QA sign-off on integration stability

## üö® Impact

**Risk Level**: Critical - Launch Blocker
**User Impact**: Core functionality failure, unable to play game
**Dependencies**: WAX testnet stability, contract deployment approval

body:

title: [MAJOR] Comprehensive Mobile Responsiveness Testing
body:
## üì± Description

Mobile layouts haven't been fully tested and validated. Need to ensure optimal user experience across mobile devices with proper touch targets and responsive behavior.

## üéØ Testing Matrix

### **Device Categories:**
- [ ] **Small Phone** (320-375px) - iPhone SE, older Android
- [ ] **Standard Phone** (375-414px) - iPhone 12/13/14, Pixel
- [ ] **Large Phone** (414-480px) - iPhone Pro Max, Android tablets
- [ ] **Small Tablet** (768-1024px) - iPad Mini, Android tablets

### **Orientation Testing:**
- [ ] **Portrait Mode** - Primary usage pattern
- [ ] **Landscape Mode** - Secondary but important

### **Browser Testing:**
- [ ] **iOS Safari** - Primary iOS browser
- [ ] **Chrome Android** - Primary Android browser
- [ ] **Firefox Mobile** - Secondary browser
- [ ] **Samsung Internet** - Popular on Samsung devices

## üéØ Acceptance Criteria

### **Touch Accessibility:**
- [ ] All buttons minimum 44px touch target (Apple/Google guidelines)
- [ ] Adequate spacing between interactive elements (8px minimum)
- [ ] Touch feedback on button presses
- [ ] No accidental touches between close elements

### **Layout Validation:**
- [ ] Single-column layout maintained on mobile
- [ ] Text remains readable without horizontal scrolling
- [ ] Images and icons scale appropriately
- [ ] No content cutoff at screen edges
- [ ] Safe area respect for devices with notches

### **Functionality Testing:**
- [ ] WAX Cloud Wallet popup works on mobile browsers
- [ ] Wallet authentication flow completes successfully
- [ ] Game transactions process correctly
- [ ] Screen transitions smooth on mobile devices
- [ ] No JavaScript errors in mobile browser consoles

### **Performance Validation:**
- [ ] Acceptable loading times on 3G networks
- [ ] Smooth animations without frame drops
- [ ] Reasonable memory usage on mobile devices
- [ ] Battery impact within acceptable range

## üîß Technical Requirements

**Viewport Configuration:**
```html
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no">
```

**CSS Media Queries:**
- Mobile: 320px - 767px
- Tablet: 768px - 1023px
- Desktop: 1024px+

**Touch Target Sizing:**
```css
.touch-target {
  min-height: 44px;
  min-width: 44px;
  padding: 8px;
}
```

## üìã Definition of Done

- Mobile experience validated on real devices (not just browser dev tools)
- Touch accessibility standards met (WCAG 2.1 guidelines)
- Any mobile-specific issues documented and resolved
- Performance benchmarks meet mobile standards
- QA sign-off on mobile user experience

## üö® Impact

**Risk Level**: Major - UX Impact
**User Impact**: Poor mobile experience could alienate significant user base
**Market Impact**: Mobile users represent majority of gaming audience

title: [MINOR] Standardize Typography System
body:
## üìù Description

Discrepancy between point-based typography specifications and responsive pixel implementation needs resolution for consistent design system.

## üéØ Current Conflicts

**User Requirements:**
- 20pt bold headers
- 16pt semi-bold body
- 12pt labels

**Project Implementation:**
- Responsive scaling 14px (mobile) to 18px (desktop)
- Montserrat/Open Sans font families
- Font weights not clearly specified

## üéØ Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Design team confirms typography approach (fixed pt vs responsive px)
- [ ] Update all documentation with consistent typography specifications
- [ ] Implement approved typography system in Unity UI
- [ ] Validate text readability across all screen sizes
- [ ] Create typography style guide for future reference
- [ ] Ensure font loading optimization for web performance

## üîß Proposed Typography System

### **Option A: Fixed Point Sizes**
```css
.header { font-size: 20pt; font-weight: bold; }
.body { font-size: 16pt; font-weight: 600; }
.label { font-size: 12pt; font-weight: normal; }
```

### **Option B: Responsive Scaling**
```css
.header { 
  font-size: clamp(18px, 4vw, 24px); 
  font-weight: bold; 
}
.body { 
  font-size: clamp(14px, 3vw, 18px); 
  font-weight: 600; 
}
.label { 
  font-size: clamp(12px, 2.5vw, 16px); 
  font-weight: normal; 
}
```

## üìã Files to Update

- `unity-client/UI_Brief.md` - Typography documentation
- Unity UI Text component presets
- CSS/style files for web components
- Design system documentation

## üìã Definition of Done

- Typography system documented and implemented consistently
- All text meets readability standards across devices
- Design team approval on implementation
- Style guide created for future development

## üö® Impact

**Risk Level**: Minor - Polish Issue
**User Impact**: Inconsistent text hierarchy, potential readability issues
**Timeline**: Quick fix once approach is decided

title: [MINOR] Implement Smooth Animations and Micro-interactions
body:
## ‚ú® Description

Add polish animations and ensure 60fps performance for all UI transitions to create a premium gaming experience.

## üéØ Animation Requirements

### **Screen Transitions:**
- [ ] **Start ‚Üí Resolving**: Smooth fade/slide transition (300ms ease-out)
- [ ] **Resolving ‚Üí Result**: Automatic transition with appropriate timing
- [ ] **Result ‚Üí Start**: "Play Again" button with satisfying feedback

### **Button Interactions:**
- [ ] **Hover Effects**: Subtle scale/glow on desktop (150ms)
- [ ] **Press Feedback**: Scale down/up on click/tap (100ms)
- [ ] **Loading States**: Spinner with smooth rotation
- [ ] **Disabled States**: Visual indication with reduced opacity

### **Game State Animations:**
- [ ] **Success Celebration**: Confetti or particle effects (optional)
- [ ] **Loading Spinner**: Smooth rotation during resolving
- [ ] **Balance Updates**: Number counting animation for DBP tokens
- [ ] **Connection Status**: Smooth color transitions for wallet state

### **Micro-interactions:**
- [ ] **Text Appearance**: Fade-in for dynamic content
- [ ] **Icon Animations**: Subtle bounces or pulses
- [ ] **Progress Indicators**: Smooth progress bar animations

## üîß Technical Specifications

### **Performance Targets:**
- **Frame Rate**: Maintain 60fps during all animations
- **Timing**: Use consistent easing functions (ease-out preferred)
- **Duration**: Follow Material Design guidelines (100-300ms)

### **Unity Animation System:**
```csharp
// Example smooth transition
public void TransitionToScreen(GameObject targetScreen) {
    targetScreen.transform.DOScale(1f, 0.3f).SetEase(Ease.OutQuart);
    targetScreen.GetComponent<CanvasGroup>().DOFade(1f, 0.3f);
}
```

### **CSS Animations (if applicable):**
```css
.smooth-transition {
  transition: all 0.3s cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.46, 0.45, 0.94);
}

.button-press {
  transform: scale(0.95);
  transition: transform 0.1s ease-out;
}
```

## üéØ Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All screen transitions smooth and consistent
- [ ] Button interactions provide satisfying feedback
- [ ] Loading animations engage users during wait times
- [ ] Performance remains stable on lower-end devices
- [ ] Animation timing feels natural and not rushed
- [ ] No janky or broken animations
- [ ] Accessibility considerations (respect prefers-reduced-motion)

## üì± Device Testing

- [ ] **High-end Desktop**: Smooth 60fps animations
- [ ] **Mid-range Mobile**: Acceptable performance (30fps minimum)
- [ ] **Low-end Mobile**: Graceful degradation if needed
- [ ] **Various Browsers**: Consistent behavior across platforms

## üìã Definition of Done

- All animations implemented and smooth
- Performance validated on target devices
- Animation system documented for future development
- QA validation of animation quality and consistency
- Accessibility considerations implemented

## üö® Impact

**Risk Level**: Minor - Polish Enhancement
**User Impact**: Enhanced perceived quality and gaming experience
**Performance Risk**: Low if implemented with performance in mind
